derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from an Anglo-Norman French variant of Old French eschapeloyre, based on late Latin scapulare (see scapular)

means.word_mean: 1. garment consisting of a long wide piece of woolen cloth worn over the shoulders with an opening for the head; part of a monastic habit
